abstract_summ: Here, Vetlife Helpline manager.[Image: see text] Deputy Editor‐in‐Chief, Dr Patrick Chien, discusses the latest thinking in women's health and highlights articles from this issue in an audio podcast available at: https://soundcloud.com/bjog/july-editorial-2020As global health systems and communities prepare to meet an unprecedented threat causing increased demands for the care of people with COVID-19, health care providers should strive to ensure continuity of reproductive health care to women and girls in the face of facility service disruption.Public health and government advice for some to self isolate and for all of us to increase social distancing poses huge challenges for the industry and its people, as well as clients and patients.The global Covid-19 outbreak is having a profound impact on everyone, including people in the veterinary profession.
title_summ: The consequences of the COVID‐19 pandemicContraception in the Era of COVID-19Looking after yourself and others.
